required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Detection of Ovarian Cancer Using an Artificial Intelligence Enabled Transvaginal Ultrasound Imaging Algorithm
clinical_study.official_title: Detection of Ovarian Cancer Using an Artificial Intelligence Enabled Transvaginal Ultrasound Imaging Algorithm

collaborator.agency: The First People's Hospital of Jingzhou
First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: Ovarian cancer is relatively rare but fatal with an annual incidence rate of 11.8 per 100 000 and a high mortality‐to‐incidence ratio of >0.6. The modest diagnostic accuracy of TVU has risen some concerns about the over-treatment.Now, with the development of artificial intelligence (AI), we may have a better chance to interpret TVU imagines with high efficiency, reproducibility and accuracy.

primary_outcome.description: diagnostic accuracy comparsion between Transvaginal Ultrasound diagnosis with and without Artificial Intelligence algorithm for ovarian cancer

secondary_outcome.measure: time cost for Transvaginal Ultrasound image interpretation
secondary_outcome.description: time cost for radiologists to interpret Transvaginal Ultrasound images

arm_group.description: radiologists interpretTransvaginal Ultrasound images without the help of Artificial Intelligence (AI) algorithm
radiologists interpretTransvaginal Ultrasound images with the help of Artificial Intelligence algorithm

intervention.intervention_name: Artificial Intelligence Enabled Transvaginal Ultrasound Imaging algorithm
intervention.description: AI Enabled Transvaginal Ultrasound diagnosis for ovarian cancer

patient_data.ipd_description: contact Prof. Gao for detialed study protocol or data after study completed by e-mail
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: all investigators in this study field can contact Prof. Gao for access by e-mail
